alert.note: Alert for Calaveras; Stanislaus; Tuolumne (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 11 at 5:37PM PDT until March 11 at 7:15PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM PST THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL STANISLAUS, SOUTH CENTRAL CALAVERAS AND TUOLUMNE COUNTIES... At 437 PM PST, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Sonora, Jamestown, town of Tuolumne. Widespread flooding is occurring in the town of Tuolumne and Sonora. Emergency managers reported significant roadway flooding in town of Tuolumne, with creeks overflowing their banks. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sonora, Springfield, Tuttletown, Chinese Camp, Vallecito, Carson Hill, Angels City, Long Barn, Copperopolis, Copper Cove Village, Hodson, Telegraph City, East Sonora, Jamestown, Columbia, Phoenix Lake-Cedar, Phoenix Lake-Cedar Ridge, Mono Vista, Soulsbyville and Tuolumne City. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
